required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Kinesio Taping for Upper Limb Function of Stroke Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Kinesio Taping for Upper Limb Function of Stroke Patients

brief_summary.textblock: Patients with stroke in the brain, due to central nervous system damage, lack of correct action patterns, limited joint movement of upper limbs, affecting the patient's performance. The Kinesio taping effect is to facilitate the muscle activity of upper limb. This program is intended to provide a treatment for patients with chronic stroke, and to observe their upper limb movements before and after using the Kinesio taping.

detailed_description.textblock: Motor impairment is the main cause of disability after stroke, leading to major health problems. Research has shown that the most common consequence of stroke is the paresis of limbs.The ability to live independently after a stroke depends on the recovery of motor functions,particularly those of the upper limb.The core concept of the Kinesio taping is to influence the brain through the sensory input, stimulate the nervous system, and improve the motor performance of the stroke patient.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Fugl-Meyer Assessment (FMA) from pre to post-intervention.
primary_outcome.description: The Fugl-Meyer Assessment (FMA) is a stroke-specific, performance-based impairment index. It is designed to assess motor functioning, balance, sensation and joint functioning in patients with post-stroke hemiplegia.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Action Research Arm Test (ARAT) from pre to post-intervention.
primary_outcome.description: The Action Research Arm Test (ARAT) is an evaluative measure to assess specific changes in limb function among post-stroke hemiplegia.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Box and Block Test (BBT) from pre to post-intervention.
primary_outcome.description: The Box and Block Test (BBT) measures unilateral gross manual dexterity for stroke patients.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Motor Activity Log (MAL) from pre to post-intervention.
secondary_outcome.description: The Motor Activity Log (MAL) is a semi-structured interview to assess arm function.

arm_group.description: The paretic upper limb is a common consequence of stroke that increases activity limitation.

intervention.description: In KT group, KT was applied using the insertion-origin muscle and space-correction technique of affected upper limb with stroke patients.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Post-stroke hemiplegia, at least 6 months since onset
- Ability to communicate and understand instructions.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Skin problems, wounds, or infection on the affected upper limb.
- The experience of using the Kinesio taping.
- A history of allergy tothe Kinesio taping.
